Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) is a division of the National Weather Service (NWS) under the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) in the United States. NCEP is responsible for providing weather, climate, and environmental forecasts and analyses to support public safety, economic planning, and environmental management. Headquartered in College Park, Maryland, it serves as a critical hub for meteorological and environmental modeling.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The Climate Forecast System (CFS) is a model representing the global interaction between Earth's oceans, land, and atmosphere. Produced by several dozen scientists under guidance from the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP), this model offers hourly data with a horizontal resolution down to one-half of a degree (approximately 56 km) around Earth for many variables. CFS uses the latest scientific approaches for taking in, or assimilating, observations from data sources including surface observations, upper air balloon observations, aircraft observations, and satellite observations.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
1. Download data from AWS S3 (s3://noaa-cfs-pds/) to the data center.
2. Utilize go-graphsplit to partition the downloaded files into individual CAR files.
3. Distribute the CAR files to the SPs via physical hard drive transport or HTTP download.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, Greater China
